contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox French commune |name = Saint-Cyr-l'École |map size = 270px |adjustable map = Saint-Cyr-l'Ecole map.png |map caption = Location (in red) within Paris inner and outer suburbs |region = Île-de-France |department = Yvelines |arrondissement = Versailles |canton = Saint-Cyr-l'École |INSEE = 78545 |postal code = 78210 |mayor = Bernard Debain |term = 2009 - 2013 |intercommunality = Grand Parc |longitude = 2.0633 |latitude = 48.8008 |elevation m = 158 |elevation min m = 99 |elevation max m = 174 |area km2 = 5.01 |population = 16365 |population date = 2006 }} '''Saint-Cyr-l'École''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the western suburbs of [[Paris]], [[France]]. It is located {{convert|21.4|km|mi|abbr=on}} from the [[Kilometre Zero|center of Paris]]. It used to host the training school for officers of the French army, the [[École Spéciale Militaire de Saint-Cyr]] (ESM), which was relocated to [[Coëtquidan]] in 1945. The old buildings of the ESM are now used by the [[lycée militaire de Saint-Cyr]] (military high school of Saint-Cyr). Inhabitants are called ''Saint-Cyriens''. ==Geography== Saint-Cyr lies in the ''[[arrondissement in France|arrondissement]]'' of [[Versailles]], west of the Park of Versailles. ==History== King [[Louis XIV of France]], at the request of [[Françoise d'Aubigné, marquise de Maintenon|Madame de Maintenon]], founded [[Maison royale de Saint-Louis]], an institute for young ladies, which later became a military hospital. [[Napoleon I of France|Napoleon I]] founded the military academy for infantry and cavalry officers in 1808. The tomb of Madame de Maintenon lies in the Chapel. == Twin towns — sister cities == * {{Flagicon|Germany}} [[Butzbach]], [[Germany]] – since 2008 * {{Flagicon|Scotland}} [[Bonnyrigg]], [[scotland]] ==Transport== [[Image:Stampe SV-4C F-BDBQ St Cyr l'Ecole 30.05.57 edited-1.jpg|thumb|left|[[Stampe SV.4]] training biplanes at the airfield in 1957]] Saint-Cyr-l'École is served by [[Saint-Cyr (SNCF)|Saint-Cyr]] station, which is an interchange station on Paris [[RER C|RER line C]], on the [[Transilien La Défense]] suburban rail line, and on the [[Transilien Paris – Montparnasse]] suburban rail line. '''Saint-Cyr-l'Ecole airfield''' is long established and lies on the edge of the commune. It is used by light aircraft flown by private pilot owners and by members of aero clubs. It is operated for public use by [[Aeroports de Paris]]. ==See also== *[[Communes of the Yvelines department]] ==References== *[http://www.insee.fr/en/home/home_page.asp INSEE] {{Reflist}} {{Commons category|Saint-Cyr-l'École}} {{Paris Metropolitan Area}} {{Yvelines communes}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Saintcyrlecole}} [[Category:Communes of Yvelines]] {{Yvelines-geo-stub}}
